newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-HANSA SAYS THOMSON RATING POSITIVE.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-HANSA SAYS THOMSON RATING POSITIVE.

text.p: Hansapank said on Wednesday the rating of Estonia and Hansapank by Thomson Bankwatch was positive and it wanted to get a rating from another top agency.

"We think it is good and especially pleasant is their vision of Estonia, which is essentially better than Thomson's appraisal of Latvia and Lithuania," Rain Lohmus, Hansapank vice-chairman, told Reuters.
"It makes us believe that if we order a rating from the other agencies, it would be quite good," he added.
"It would be worth to get a rating to lower our interest expenses," he added.
Thomson earlier gave Estonia a sovereign risk rating of BBB- and rated Hansapank's short-term local currency debt of LC-1.
Lohmus said his bank would see a lower interest charge on a recently launched 100 million mark syndicated loan if the bank gets a rating by Moody's or Standard & Poor's of at least BBB-.
"Actually it would be good if the Estonian Republic got the rating for itself," Lohmus said.
